resources.string: Seville is the capital of Andalusia, globally known for its vibrant culture, its impressive Mudejar and Gothic architecture like the Giralda and the Real Alcázar, and for being the cradle of flamenco and festive traditions like Holy Week (Semana Santa) and the April Fair (Feria de Abril).

Granada is an Andalusian jewel nestled at the foot of Sierra Nevada, globally famous for housing the majestic Alhambra, a Nasrid palace complex that is the maximum exponent of Islamic architecture in Western Europe.

Córdoba is a city with a monumental history that was the splendid capital of the Umayyad Caliphate, treasuring today the unparalleled Mosque-Cathedral as the ultimate symbol of the historical coexistence of cultures, along with its famous flowery streets and the Patios Festival.
